entries.title: Stock Futures Rise Ahead of Retail Earnings
entries.description: Stock futures tied to the S&P 500, Dow industrials and Nasdaq-100 all inched higher ahead of retail and consumer product firms.

entries.title: Fanatics Hires New Betting Unit CMO From Gucci
entries.description: Selena Kalvaria is tasked with building the Fanatics Sportsbook brand after a period of luring new bettors through deals.

entries.title: Technology Investor Invictus Backs Cybersecurity-Focused ThreatModeler
entries.description: The $60 million majority investment represents the first institutional cash for the tool maker for software developers.

entries.title: A Closer Look
entries.description: Selections from ‘With Dad’ by Richard Jackson, illustrated by Brian Floca

entries.title: A Closer Look
entries.description: Selections from ‘Up High’ by Matt Hunt

entries.title: A Closer Look
entries.description: Selections from ‘Big Bear and Little Bear Go Fishing’ by Amy Hest, illustrated by Erin E. Stead

entries.title: A Closer Look
entries.description: Selections from ‘Lionel Is Just Like Dad’ by Éric Veillé

entries.title: Dollar Could Turn Lower if U.S. Data Weakens, Bank of Canada Cuts Rates
entries.description: The dollar has risen following an unwinding of carry trades but could fall if U.S. economic data are softer and the Bank of Canada cuts interest rates, ING said.

entries.title: Israel and Hezbollah Move Closer to Full-Scale War
entries.description: Months of escalating hostilities with the Lebanese militant group has added pressure on Israel’s government to secure its northern border.

entries.title: A Bug Allowed Kids to Visit X-Rated Sites. Apple Took Three Years to Fix It.
entries.description: Apple’s Screen Time continues to be marred by bugs that let its youngest users circumvent parental controls.

entries.title: Torry's Take: Job Openings Point to Cooling in Labor Market Ahead of Friday's Payrolls
entries.description: The nation’s employers reported fewer open jobs in April, adding to signs that supply and demand for workers are coming back into balance after pandemic-era disruptions.

entries.title: The $21 Billion Lawsuit That Could Break the NFL
entries.description: A class-action case over the league’s “Sunday Ticket” package is finally headed to trial in a fundamental challenge to the league’s media-rights model.

entries.title: The Case Against Elon Musk's $46 Billion Pay Deal
entries.description: Tesla’s board is asking shareholders to approve a substantial dilution of their stakes for no good reason.

entries.title: 80 Years After D-Day, France Examines the Trauma of Allied Bombings
entries.description: Macron is preparing to commemorate the more than 50,000 French civilians killed in U.S. and British air raids during World War II.

entries.title: SAP to Buy Digital Adoption Platform WalkMe
entries.description: SAP agreed to buy Nasdaq-listed WalkMe for $1.5 billion, in a deal that seeks to bolster the software group’s business artificial-intelligence offerings.

entries.title: Analysis: U.S. and Europe Are on the Same Economic Track After All
entries.description: The U.S. economy grew more rapidly than its eurozone counterpart last year. But the two are converging, and central bank policy is likely to follow.

entries.title: For Lawmakers Along the Southern Border, Immigration Policy Hits Home
entries.description: Competitive contests in New Mexico, Arizona and Texas could determine control of the House.

entries.title: Digital Freight Startup Transfix Sells Brokerage Unit
entries.description: The company, which had planned a public listing until a freight demand downturn hit the sector, will focus on its software business.

entries.title: Dollar Tree Explores Sale of Family Dollar
entries.description: The discount retailer has tapped bankers at JPMorgan for strategic review.

entries.title: German November 2030 Bund Seen Attractive in Relative Value Terms Pre-Auction
entries.description: Germany’s 2.40% November 2030 Bund, which will be reopened at auction on Wednesday, is attractive relative to some of its peers, although it sits on the most expensive area on the German bond curve, UniCredit Research said.
